meanings.definition: To move back and forth or up and down quickly and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The dog will shake off the water after a bath.
meanings.sent2: I like to shake my legs when I'm nervous.
meanings.sent3: The earthquake made the ground shake like jelly.
meanings.sent4: Her words shook me to my core.
meanings.sent5: The thunder made the whole house shake violently.

meanings.definition: To cause to tremble or quiver.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise will shake the windows.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind can shake the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent3: The scary movie made him shake with fear.
meanings.sent4: His powerful speech shook the audience emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news shook her to the core.

meanings.definition: A milkshake, a cold drink made of milk, flavoring, and usually ice cream.
meanings.sent1: I ordered a chocolate shake at the diner.
meanings.sent2: She loves to have a strawberry shake after school.
meanings.sent3: The milkshake was so thick, it was like drinking a dessert.
meanings.sent4: The milkshake was a sweet treat on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The vanilla shake was topped with whipped cream and a cherry.
